verses.kjv: Moreover, brethren, I would not that ye should be ignorant, how that all our fathers were under the cloud, and all passed through the sea;
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, I don't want you to forget that all of our ancestors traveled under the cloud, and all of them passed through the sea.

verses.kjv: And were all baptized unto Moses in the cloud and in the sea;
verses.ct: They were all baptized into Moses through the cloud and through the sea.

verses.kjv: And did all eat the same spiritual meat;
verses.ct: They all ate the same spiritual food,

verses.kjv: And did all drink the same spiritual drink: for they drank of that spiritual Rock that followed them: and that Rock was Christ.
verses.ct: and they all drank the same spiritual water. They drank from the spiritual rock that traveled with them, and that rock was Christ.

verses.kjv: But with many of them God was not well pleased: for they were overthrown in the wilderness.
verses.ct: Yet God was not pleased with most of them, and their bodies were scattered across the wilderness.

verses.kjv: Now these things were our examples, to the intent we should not lust after evil things, as they also lusted.
verses.ct: These events serve as warnings for us, so that we won't crave what is evil the way they did.

verses.kjv: Neither be ye idolaters, as were some of them; as it is written, The people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play.
verses.ct: Don't become idol worshipers like some of them were. As Scripture says, 'The people sat down to eat and drink, then got up to engage in wild revelry.'

verses.kjv: Neither let us commit fornication, as some of them committed, and fell in one day three and twenty thousand.
verses.ct: We must not engage in sexual immorality, as some of them did — and 23,000 of them died in a single day.

verses.kjv: Neither let us tempt Christ, as some of them also tempted, and were destroyed of serpents.
verses.ct: We must not put Christ to the test, as some of them did — and they were killed by snakes.

verses.kjv: Neither murmur ye, as some of them also murmured, and were destroyed of the destroyer.
verses.ct: And don't complain, as some of them did — and they were killed by the destroying angel.

verses.kjv: Now all these things happened unto them for ensamples: and they are written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the world are come.
verses.ct: All of these things happened to them as examples, and they were recorded as warnings for us who are living at the culmination of the ages.

verses.kjv: Wherefore let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he fall.
verses.ct: So if you think you're standing firm, be careful that you don't fall.

verses.kjv: There hath no temptation taken you but such as is common to man: but God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that ye are able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that ye may be able to bear it.
verses.ct: No temptation has come your way that isn't common to everyone. But God is faithful — he will not let you be tempted beyond what you can handle. Along with the temptation, he will also provide a way out so that you can endure it.

verses.kjv: Wherefore, my dearly beloved, flee from idolatry.
verses.ct: So then, my dear friends, stay far away from idol worship.

verses.kjv: I speak as to wise men; judge ye what I say.
verses.ct: I'm speaking to you as intelligent people — evaluate what I'm saying for yourselves.

verses.kjv: The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of Christ? The bread which we break, is it not the communion of the body of Christ?
verses.ct: When we give thanks over the cup of blessing, isn't that a sharing in the blood of Christ? When we break the bread, isn't that a sharing in the body of Christ?

verses.kjv: For we being many are one bread, and one body: for we are all partakers of that one bread.
verses.ct: Since there is one bread, we who are many form one body, because we all share that one bread.

verses.kjv: Behold Israel after the flesh: are not they which eat of the sacrifices partakers of the altar?
verses.ct: Consider the people of Israel: don't those who eat the sacrifices share in what the altar represents?

verses.kjv: What say I then? that the idol is any thing, or that which is offered in sacrifice to idols is any thing?
verses.ct: So what am I saying? That an idol actually means something? Or that food sacrificed to an idol has any real significance?

verses.kjv: But I say, that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice, they sacrifice to devils, and not to God: and I would not that ye should have fellowship with devils.
verses.ct: No — what I'm saying is that the sacrifices offered by pagans are actually offered to demons, not to God. And I don't want you to become partners with demons.

verses.kjv: Ye cannot drink the cup of the Lord, and the cup of devils: ye cannot be partakers of the Lord’s table, and of the table of devils.
verses.ct: You can't drink from the Lord's cup and also from the cup of demons. You can't participate at the Lord's table and also at the table of demons.

verses.kjv: Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? are we stronger than he?
verses.ct: Are we trying to provoke the Lord to jealousy? Do we think we're stronger than he is?

verses.kjv: All things are lawful for me, but all things are not expedient: all things are lawful for me, but all things edify not.
verses.ct: "Everything is permissible for me" — but not everything is beneficial. "Everything is permissible for me" — but not everything builds others up.

verses.kjv: Let no man seek his own, but every man another’s wealth.
verses.ct: No one should focus on their own interests, but rather on the good of others.

verses.kjv: Whatsoever is sold in the shambles, that eat, asking no question for conscience sake:
verses.ct: Eat whatever is sold at the meat market without raising questions about it for the sake of conscience.

verses.kjv: For the earth is the Lord’s, and the fulness thereof.
verses.ct: After all, the earth belongs to the Lord, and everything in it.

verses.kjv: If any of them that believe not bid you to a feast, and ye be disposed to go; whatsoever is set before you, eat, asking no question for conscience sake.
verses.ct: If an unbeliever invites you to a meal and you decide to go, eat whatever is placed in front of you without raising questions about it for the sake of conscience.

verses.kjv: But if any man say unto you, This is offered in sacrifice unto idols, eat not for his sake that shewed it, and for conscience sake: for the earth is the Lord’s, and the fulness thereof:
verses.ct: But if someone tells you, 'This food was offered in sacrifice to an idol,' then don't eat it — for the sake of the person who told you and for the sake of conscience.

verses.kjv: Conscience, I say, not thine own, but of the other: for why is my liberty judged of another man’s conscience?
verses.ct: I'm talking about the other person's conscience, not yours. Why should my freedom be restricted by someone else's conscience?

verses.kjv: For if I by grace be a partaker, why am I evil spoken of for that for which I give thanks?
verses.ct: If I eat with gratitude, why should I be criticized for something I'm giving thanks for?

verses.kjv: Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of God.
verses.ct: So whether you eat, drink, or do anything else, do it all for the glory of God.

verses.kjv: Give none offence, neither to the Jews, nor to the Gentiles, nor to the church of God:
verses.ct: Don't cause anyone to stumble — not Jews, not Greeks, and not the church of God.

verses.kjv: Even as I please all men in all things, not seeking mine own profit, but the profit of many, that they may be saved.
verses.ct: I try to accommodate everyone in every situation, not looking out for my own benefit but for the benefit of the many, so that they might be saved.
